alert.note: Alert for Olmsted (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 19 at 1:56PM CDT until May 21 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN WINONA AND SOUTHEASTERN OLMSTED COUNTIES... At 155 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over St. Charles, or 19 miles north of Preston, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Public reported 1 to 2 inch hail south of Rochester at 150 PM. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Winona and southeastern Olmsted Counties, including the following locations... Saratoga, County Roads 9 And 10, County Roads 6 And 33, County Roads 137 And 136, Utica, Cummingsville and Bethany. This includes Interstate 90 in Minnesota between mile markers 220 and 240. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: This storm is producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
